title: Treasury Yields Rise After Jobs Report
sub_head: Yields initially dropped after the employment data, but settled higher
body:
Selling in U.S. government bonds continued Friday, pushing the 10-year Treasury yield above 1.6% for the first time since early June, after investors shrugged off a lackluster September jobs report.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note settled at 1.604%, according to Tradeweb, compared with 1.591% just before the report was released and 1.570% Thursday.
